title: After trying the knot, Justin Bieber says new song '10,000 hours' with Dan + Shay is 'wedding music'
text:
After trying the knot, Justin Bieber says new song '10,000 hours' with Dan + Shay is 'wedding music' originally appeared on goodmorningamerica.com

Justin Bieber and country music?

You better Belieb it!

The singer teamed up with Dan + Shay for a new song called "10,000 Hours," which dropped Friday.

(MORE: First pictures from Justin Bieber and Hailey Baldwin’s wedding revealed)

The song and video feature the artists singing to their loved ones.

"I'd spend 10,000 hours and 10,000 more if that's what it takes," the lyrics say.

And you guessed it, the video also featured Bieber's recent wife, Hailey Baldwin.

(MORE: Justin Bieber shares throwback photo with wife ahead of second wedding)

In the clip, the newlyweds first video together, they are featured kissing on a bed of flowers and more.

The Biebers got re-married in South Carolina on Monday, a year after they were married in New York City.

"When you think about your forever now, do you think of me?" Bieber sang to his blushing bride.

In fact, on Instagram, Bieber said he hopes the song would be used in their wedding playlist.

Dan + Shay gave an interview to Taste of Country on Thursday, revealing they were at the wedding earlier this week and that "10,000 Hours" was indeed performed.

"The wedding was amazing," the guys said, adding it was "beautiful and wonderfully done."
